summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for gaining wisdom and instruction;
    for understanding words of insight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for receiving instruction in prudent behaviour,
    doing what is right and just and fair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for giving prudence to those who are simple,
    knowledge and discretion to the young –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let the wise listen and add to their learning,
    and let the discerning get guidance –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for understanding proverbs and parables,
    the sayings and riddles of the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge,
    but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my son, to your father’s instruction
    and do not forsake your mother’s teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are a garland to grace your head
    and a chain to adorn your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if sinful men entice you,
    do not give in to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
let’s swallow them alive, like the grave,
    and whole, like those who go down to the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
we will get all sorts of valuable things
    and fill our houses with plunder;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
cast lots with us;
    we will all share the loot’–
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my son, do not go along with them,
    do not set foot on their paths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for their feet rush into evil,
    they are swift to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How useless to spread a net
    where every bird can see it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These men lie in wait for their own blood;
    they ambush only themselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such are the paths of all who go after ill-gotten gain;
    it takes away the life of those who get it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out in the open wisdom calls aloud,
    she raises her voice in the public square;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
on top of the wall she cries out,
    at the city gate she makes her speech:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘How long will you who are simple love your simple ways?
    How long will mockers delight in mockery
    and fools hate knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Repent at my rebuke!
    Then I will pour out my thoughts to you,
    I will make known to you my teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But since you refuse to listen when I call
    and no one pays attention when I stretch out my hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
since you disregard all my advice
    and do not accept my rebuke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I in turn will laugh when disaster strikes you;
    I will mock when calamity overtakes you –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when calamity overtakes you like a storm,
    when disaster sweeps over you like a whirlwind,
    when distress and trouble overwhelm you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Then they will call to me but I will not answer;
    they will look for me but will not find me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
since they hated knowledge
    and did not choose to fear the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since they would not accept my advice
    and spurned my rebuke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they will eat the fruit of their ways
    and be filled with the fruit of their schemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the waywardness of the simple will kill them,
    and the complacency of fools will destroy them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but whoever listens to me will live in safety
    and be at ease, without fear of harm.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you accept my words
    and store up my commands within you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
turning your ear to wisdom
    and applying your heart to understanding –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
indeed, if you call out for insight
    and cry aloud for understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and if you look for it as for silver
    and search for it as for hidden treasure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then you will understand the fear of the Lord
    and find the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord gives wisdom;
    from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He holds success in store for the upright,
    he is a shield to those whose way of life is blameless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he guards the course of the just
    and protects the way of his faithful ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will understand what is right and just
    and fair – every good path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For wisdom will enter your heart,
    and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discretion will protect you,
    and understanding will guard you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom will save you from the ways of wicked men,
    from men whose words are perverse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who have left the straight paths
    to walk in dark ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who delight in doing wrong
    and rejoice in the perverseness of evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
whose paths are crooked
    and who are devious in their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom will save you also from the adulterous woman,
    from the wayward woman with her seductive words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who has left the partner of her youth
    and ignored the covenant she made before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely her house leads down to death
    and her paths to the spirits of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
None who go to her return
    or attain the paths of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus you will walk in the ways of the good
    and keep to the paths of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the upright will live in the land,
    and the blameless will remain in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the wicked will be cut off from the land,
    and the unfaithful will be torn from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not forget my teaching,
    but keep my commands in your heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they will prolong your life many years
    and bring you peace and prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will win favour and a good name
    in the sight of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart
    and lean not on your own understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in all your ways submit to him,
    and he will make your paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
    fear the Lord and shun evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This will bring health to your body
    and nourishment to your bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honour the Lord with your wealth,
    with the firstfruits of all your crops;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then your barns will be filled to overflowing,
    and your vats will brim over with new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not despise the Lord’s discipline,
    and do not resent his rebuke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Lord disciplines those he loves,
    as a father the son he delights in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who find wisdom,
    those who gain understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for she is more profitable than silver
    and yields better returns than gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is more precious than rubies;
    nothing you desire can compare with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long life is in her right hand;
    in her left hand are riches and honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her ways are pleasant ways,
    and all her paths are peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her;
    those who hold her fast will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By wisdom the Lord laid the earth’s foundations,
    by understanding he set the heavens in place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by his knowledge the watery depths were divided,
    and the clouds let drop the dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not let wisdom and understanding out of your sight,
    preserve sound judgment and discretion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they will be life for you,
    an ornament to grace your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will go on your way in safety,
    and your foot will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you lie down, you will not be afraid;
    when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have no fear of sudden disaster
    or of the ruin that overtakes the wicked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord will be at your side
    and will keep your foot from being snared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,
    when it is in your power to act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say to your neighbour,
    ‘Come back tomorrow and I’ll give it to you’–
    when you already have it with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not plot harm against your neighbour,
    who lives trustfully near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not accuse anyone for no reason –
    when they have done you no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not envy the violent
    or choose any of their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord detests the perverse
    but takes the upright into his confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord’s curse is on the house of the wicked,
    but he blesses the home of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He mocks proud mockers
    but shows favour to the humble and oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise inherit honour,
    but fools get only shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my sons, to a father’s instruction;
    pay attention and gain understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I give you sound learning,
    so do not forsake my teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I too was a son to my father,
    still tender, and cherished by my mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Get wisdom, get understanding;
    do not forget my words or turn away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forsake wisdom, and she will protect you;
    love her, and she will watch over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beginning of wisdom is this: get wisdom.
    Though it cost all you have, get understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cherish her, and she will exalt you;
    embrace her, and she will honour you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will give you a garland to grace your head
    and present you with a glorious crown.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my son, accept what I say,
    and the years of your life will be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I instruct you in the way of wisdom
    and lead you along straight paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you walk, your steps will not be hampered;
    when you run, you will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hold on to instruction, do not let it go;
    guard it well, for it is your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not set foot on the path of the wicked
    or walk in the way of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Avoid it, do not travel on it;
    turn from it and go on your way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they cannot rest until they do evil;
    they are robbed of sleep till they make someone stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They eat the bread of wickedness
    and drink the wine of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The path of the righteous is like the morning sun,
    shining ever brighter till the full light of day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness;
    they do not know what makes them stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, pay attention to what I say;
    turn your ear to my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let them out of your sight,
    keep them within your heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they are life to those who find them
    and health to one’s whole body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Above all else, guard your heart,
    for everything you do flows from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your mouth free of perversity;
    keep corrupt talk far from your lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your eyes look straight ahead;
    fix your gaze directly before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give careful thought to the paths for your feet
    and be steadfast in all your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not turn to the right or the left;
    keep your foot from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, pay attention to my wisdom,
    turn your ear to my words of insight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you may maintain discretion
    and your lips may preserve knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the lips of the adulterous woman drip honey,
    and her speech is smoother than oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but in the end she is bitter as gall,
    sharp as a double-edged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her feet go down to death;
    her steps lead straight to the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She gives no thought to the way of life;
    her paths wander aimlessly, but she does not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now then, my sons, listen to me;
    do not turn aside from what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep to a path far from her,
    do not go near the door of her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest you lose your honour to others
    and your dignity to one who is cruel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest strangers feast on your wealth
    and your toil enrich the house of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the end of your life you will groan,
    when your flesh and body are spent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will say, ‘How I hated discipline!
    How my heart spurned correction!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would not obey my teachers
    or turn my ear to my instructors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I was soon in serious trouble
    in the assembly of God’s people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drink water from your own cistern,
    running water from your own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should your springs overflow in the streets,
    your streams of water in the public squares?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be yours alone,
    never to be shared with strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May your fountain be blessed,
    and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A loving doe, a graceful deer –
    may her breasts satisfy you always,
    may you ever be intoxicated with her love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, my son, be intoxicated with another man’s wife?
    Why embrace the bosom of a wayward woman?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your ways are in full view of the Lord,
    and he examines all your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare them;
    the cords of their sins hold them fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For lack of discipline they will die,
    led astray by their own great folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you have put up security for your neighbour,
    if you have shaken hands in pledge for a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you have been trapped by what you said,
    ensnared by the words of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So do this, my son, to free yourself,
    since you have fallen into your neighbour’s hands:
go – to the point of exhaustion – 
    and give your neighbour no rest!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Allow no sleep to your eyes,
    no slumber to your eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,
    like a bird from the snare of the fowler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go to the ant, you sluggard;
    consider its ways and be wise!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It has no commander,
    no overseer or ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yet it stores its provisions in summer
    and gathers its food at harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you lie there, you sluggard?
    When will you get up from your sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to rest –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and poverty will come on you like a thief
    and scarcity like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A troublemaker and a villain,
    who goes about with a corrupt mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who winks maliciously with his eye,
    signals with his feet
    and motions with his fingers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who plots evil with deceit in his heart –
    he always stirs up conflict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore disaster will overtake him in an instant;
    he will suddenly be destroyed – without remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are six things the Lord hates,
    seven that are detestable to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
haughty eyes,
        a lying tongue,
        hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a heart that devises wicked schemes,
        feet that are quick to rush into evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a false witness who pours out lies
        and a person who stirs up conflict in the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep your father’s command
    and do not forsake your mother’s teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them always on your heart;
    fasten them round your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For this command is a lamp,
    this teaching is a light,
and correction and instruction
    are the way to life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
keeping you from your neighbour’s wife,
    from the smooth talk of a wayward woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not lust in your heart after her beauty
    or let her captivate you with her eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a prostitute can be had for a loaf of bread,
    but another man’s wife preys on your very life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man scoop fire into his lap
    without his clothes being burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man walk on hot coals
    without his feet being scorched?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So is he who sleeps with another man’s wife;
    no one who touches her will go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People do not despise a thief if he steals
    to satisfy his hunger when he is starving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet if he is caught, he must pay sevenfold,
    though it costs him all the wealth of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But a man who commits adultery has no sense;
    whoever does so destroys himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blows and disgrace are his lot,
    and his shame will never be wiped away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For jealousy arouses a husband’s fury,
    and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not accept any compensation;
    he will refuse a bribe, however great it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep my words
    and store up my commands within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep my commands and you will live;
    guard my teachings as the apple of your eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them on your fingers;
    write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to wisdom, ‘You are my sister,’
    and to insight, ‘You are my relative.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will keep you from the adulterous woman,
    from the wayward woman with her seductive words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the window of my house
    I looked down through the lattice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I saw among the simple,
    I noticed among the young men,
    a youth who had no sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was going down the street near her corner,
    walking along in the direction of her house
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
at twilight, as the day was fading,
    as the dark of night set in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then out came a woman to meet him,
    dressed like a prostitute and with crafty intent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(She is unruly and defiant,
    her feet never stay at home;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
now in the street, now in the squares,
    at every corner she lurks.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She took hold of him and kissed him
    and with a brazen face she said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Today I fulfilled my vows,
    and I have food from my fellowship offering at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I came out to meet you;
    I looked for you and have found you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have covered my bed
    with coloured linens from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have perfumed my bed
    with myrrh, aloes and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let’s drink deeply of love till morning;
    let’s enjoy ourselves with love!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My husband is not at home;
    he has gone on a long journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He took his purse filled with money
    and will not be home till full moon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With persuasive words she led him astray;
    she seduced him with her smooth talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All at once he followed her
    like an ox going to the slaughter,
like a deer stepping into a noose
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
till an arrow pierces his liver,
like a bird darting into a snare,
    little knowing it will cost him his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now then, my sons, listen to me;
    pay attention to what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let your heart turn to her ways
    or stray into her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the victims she has brought down;
    her slain are a mighty throng.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her house is a highway to the grave,
    leading down to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does not wisdom call out?
    Does not understanding raise her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the highest point along the way,
    where the paths meet, she takes her stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
beside the gate leading into the city,
    at the entrance, she cries aloud:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘To you, O people, I call out;
    I raise my voice to all humanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who are simple, gain prudence;
    you who are foolish, set your hearts on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, for I have trustworthy things to say;
    I open my lips to speak what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth speaks what is true,
    for my lips detest wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the words of my mouth are just;
    none of them is crooked or perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the discerning all of them are right;
    they are upright to those who have found knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Choose my instruction instead of silver,
    knowledge rather than choice gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for wisdom is more precious than rubies,
    and nothing you desire can compare with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I, wisdom, dwell together with prudence;
    I possess knowledge and discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Counsel and sound judgment are mine;
    I have insight, I have power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me kings reign
    and rulers issue decrees that are just;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by me princes govern,
    and nobles – all who rule on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love those who love me,
    and those who seek me find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With me are riches and honour,
    enduring wealth and prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My fruit is better than fine gold;
    what I yield surpasses choice silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I walk in the way of righteousness,
    along the paths of justice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
bestowing a rich inheritance on those who love me
    and making their treasuries full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord brought me forth as the first of his works,
    before his deeds of old;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was formed long ages ago,
    at the very beginning, when the world came to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When there were no watery depths, I was given birth,
    when there were no springs overflowing with water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
before the mountains were settled in place,
    before the hills, I was given birth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
before he made the world or its fields
    or any of the dust of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was there when he set the heavens in place,
    when he marked out the horizon on the face of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he established the clouds above
    and fixed securely the fountains of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he gave the sea its boundary
    so that the waters would not overstep his command,
and when he marked out the foundations of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I was constantly at his side.
I was filled with delight day after day,
    rejoicing always in his presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
rejoicing in his whole world
    and delighting in the human race.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Now then, my children, listen to me;
    blessed are those who keep my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to my instruction and be wise;
    do not disregard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who listen to me,
    watching daily at my doors,
    waiting at my doorway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For those who find me find life
    and receive favour from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who fail to find me harm themselves;
    all who hate me love death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom has built her house;
    she has set up its seven pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has prepared her meat and mixed her wine;
    she has also set her table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has sent out her servants, and she calls
    from the highest point of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Let all who are simple come to my house!’
To those who have no sense she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Come, eat my food
    and drink the wine I have mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave your simple ways and you will live;
    walk in the way of insight.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever corrects a mocker invites insults;
    whoever rebukes the wicked incurs abuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rebuke mockers or they will hate you;
    rebuke the wise and they will love you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instruct the wise and they will be wiser still;
    teach the righteous and they will add to their learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
    and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For through wisdom your days will be many,
    and years will be added to your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are wise, your wisdom will reward you;
    if you are a mocker, you alone will suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly is an unruly woman;
    she is simple and knows nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She sits at the door of her house,
    on a seat at the highest point of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
calling out to those who pass by,
    who go straight on their way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Let all who are simple come to my house!’
To those who have no sense she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Stolen water is sweet;
    food eaten in secret is delicious!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But little do they know that the dead are there,
    that her guests are deep in the realm of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proverbs of Solomon:
A wise son brings joy to his father,
    but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ill-gotten treasures have no lasting value,
    but righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord does not let the righteous go hungry,
    but he thwarts the craving of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lazy hands make for poverty,
    but diligent hands bring wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gathers crops in summer is a prudent son,
    but he who sleeps during harvest is a disgraceful son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessings crown the head of the righteous,
    but violence overwhelms the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of the righteous is used in blessings,
    but the name of the wicked will rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise in heart accept commands,
    but a chattering fool comes to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks in integrity walks securely,
    but whoever takes crooked paths will be found out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever winks maliciously causes grief,
    and a chattering fool comes to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
    but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hatred stirs up conflict,
    but love covers over all wrongs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning,
    but a rod is for the back of one who has no sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise store up knowledge,
    but the mouth of a fool invites ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wealth of the rich is their fortified city,
    but poverty is the ruin of the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wages of the righteous is life,
    but the earnings of the wicked are sin and death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever heeds discipline shows the way to life,
    but whoever ignores correction leads others astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever conceals hatred with lying lips
    and spreads slander is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sin is not ended by multiplying words,
    but the prudent hold their tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the righteous is choice silver,
    but the heart of the wicked is of little value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous nourish many,
    but fools die for lack of sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of the Lord brings wealth,
    without painful toil for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool finds pleasure in wicked schemes,
    but a person of understanding delights in wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What the wicked dread will overtake them;
    what the righteous desire will be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the storm has swept by, the wicked are gone,
    but the righteous stand firm for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
    so are sluggards to those who send them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord adds length to life,
    but the years of the wicked are cut short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prospect of the righteous is joy,
    but the hopes of the wicked come to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the Lord is a refuge for the blameless,
    but it is the ruin of those who do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will never be uprooted,
    but the wicked will not remain in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the mouth of the righteous comes the fruit of wisdom,
    but a perverse tongue will be silenced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous know what finds favour,
    but the mouth of the wicked only what is perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests dishonest scales,
    but accurate weights find favour with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When pride comes, then comes disgrace,
    but with humility comes wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The integrity of the upright guides them,
    but the unfaithful are destroyed by their duplicity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth is worthless in the day of wrath,
    but righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the blameless makes their paths straight,
    but the wicked are brought down by their own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the upright delivers them,
    but the unfaithful are trapped by evil desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hopes placed in mortals die with them;
    all the promise of their power comes to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous person is rescued from trouble,
    and it falls on the wicked instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With their mouths the godless destroy their neighbours,
    but through knowledge the righteous escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous prosper, the city rejoices;
    when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through the blessing of the upright a city is exalted,
    but by the mouth of the wicked it is destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever derides their neighbour has no sense,
    but the one who has understanding holds their tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gossip betrays a confidence,
    but a trustworthy person keeps a secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For lack of guidance a nation falls,
    but victory is won through many advisors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer,
    but whoever refuses to shake hands in pledge is safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A kind-hearted woman gains honour,
    but ruthless men gain only wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who are kind benefit themselves,
    but the cruel bring ruin on themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked person earns deceptive wages,
    but the one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly the righteous attain life,
    but whoever pursues evil finds death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests those whose hearts are perverse,
    but he delights in those whose ways are blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be sure of this: the wicked will not go unpunished,
    but those who are righteous will go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout
    is a beautiful woman who shows no discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the righteous ends only in good,
    but the hope of the wicked only in wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One person gives freely, yet gains even more;
    another withholds unduly, but comes to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A generous person will prosper;
    whoever refreshes others will be refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People curse the one who hoards grain,
    but they pray God’s blessing on the one who is willing to sell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever seeks good finds favour,
    but evil comes to one who searches for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who trust in their riches will fall,
    but the righteous will thrive like a green leaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever brings ruin on their family will inherit only wind,
    and the fool will be servant to the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
    and the one who is wise saves lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the righteous receive their due on earth,
    how much more the ungodly and the sinner!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,
    but whoever hates correction is stupid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good people obtain favour from the Lord,
    but he condemns those who devise wicked schemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one can be established through wickedness,
    but the righteous cannot be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wife of noble character is her husband’s crown,
    but a disgraceful wife is like decay in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the righteous are just,
    but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood,
    but the speech of the upright rescues them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are overthrown and are no more,
    but the house of the righteous stands firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person is praised according to their prudence,
    and one with a warped mind is despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to be a nobody and yet have a servant
    than pretend to be somebody and have no food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous care for the needs of their animals,
    but the kindest acts of the wicked are cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who work their land will have abundant food,
    but those who chase fantasies have no sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked desire the stronghold of evildoers,
    but the root of the righteous endures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evildoers are trapped by their sinful talk,
    and so the innocent escape trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of their lips people are filled with good things,
    and the work of their hands brings them reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of fools seems right to them,
    but the wise listen to advice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools show their annoyance at once,
    but the prudent overlook an insult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An honest witness tells the truth,
    but a false witness tells lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the reckless pierce like swords,
    but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truthful lips endure for ever,
    but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deceit is in the hearts of those who plot evil,
    but those who promote peace have joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No harm overtakes the righteous,
    but the wicked have their fill of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests lying lips,
    but he delights in people who are trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prudent keep their knowledge to themselves,
    but a fool’s heart blurts out folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Diligent hands will rule,
    but laziness ends in forced labour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anxiety weighs down the heart,
    but a kind word cheers it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous choose their friends carefully,
    but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lazy do not roast any game,
    but the diligent feed on the riches of the hunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the way of righteousness there is life;
    along that path is immortality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son heeds his father’s instruction,
    but a mocker does not respond to rebukes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of their lips people enjoy good things,
    but the unfaithful have an appetite for violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who guard their lips preserve their lives,
    but those who speak rashly will come to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sluggard’s appetite is never filled,
    but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous hate what is false,
    but the wicked make themselves obnoxious
    and bring shame on themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness guards the person of integrity,
    but wickedness overthrows the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One person pretends to be rich, yet has nothing;
    another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person’s riches may ransom their life,
    but the poor cannot respond to threatening rebukes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the righteous shines brightly,
    but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is strife, there is pride,
    but wisdom is found in those who take advice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dishonest money dwindles away,
    but whoever gathers money little by little makes it grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
    but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever scorns instruction will pay for it,
    but whoever respects a command is rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
    turning a person from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good judgment wins favour,
    but the way of the unfaithful leads to their destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who are prudent act with knowledge,
    but fools expose their folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked messenger falls into trouble,
    but a trustworthy envoy brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever disregards discipline comes to poverty and shame,
    but whoever heeds correction is honoured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul,
    but fools detest turning from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Walk with the wise and become wise,
    for a companion of fools suffers harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trouble pursues the sinner,
    but the righteous are rewarded with good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good person leaves an inheritance for their children’s children,
    but a sinner’s wealth is stored up for the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An unploughed field produces food for the poor,
    but injustice sweeps it away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever spares the rod hates their children,
    but the one who loves their children is careful to discipline them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous eat to their hearts’ content,
    but the stomach of the wicked goes hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise woman builds her house,
    but with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever fears the Lord walks uprightly,
    but those who despise him are devious in their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s mouth lashes out with pride,
    but the lips of the wise protect them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there are no oxen, the manger is empty,
    but from the strength of an ox come abundant harvests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An honest witness does not deceive,
    but a false witness pours out lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mocker seeks wisdom and finds none,
    but knowledge comes easily to the discerning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stay away from a fool,
    for you will not find knowledge on their lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wisdom of the prudent is to give thought to their ways,
    but the folly of fools is deception.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools mock at making amends for sin,
    but goodwill is found among the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each heart knows its own bitterness,
    and no one else can share its joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
    but the tent of the upright will flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that appears to be right,
    but in the end it leads to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even in laughter the heart may ache,
    and rejoicing may end in grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The faithless will be fully repaid for their ways,
    and the good rewarded for theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple believe anything,
    but the prudent give thought to their steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise fear the Lord and shun evil,
    but a fool is hotheaded and yet feels secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A quick-tempered person does foolish things,
    and the one who devises evil schemes is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple inherit folly,
    but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evildoers will bow down in the presence of the good,
    and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor are shunned even by their neighbours,
    but the rich have many friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a sin to despise one’s neighbour,
    but blessed is the one who is kind to the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not those who plot evil go astray?
    But those who plan what is good find love and faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All hard work brings a profit,
    but mere talk leads only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wealth of the wise is their crown,
    but the folly of fools yields folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A truthful witness saves lives,
    but a false witness is deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever fears the Lord has a secure fortress,
    and for their children it will be a refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life,
    turning a person from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A large population is a king’s glory,
    but without subjects a prince is ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is patient has great understanding,
    but one who is quick-tempered displays folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A heart at peace gives life to the body,
    but envy rots the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever oppresses the poor shows contempt for their Maker,
    but whoever is kind to the needy honours God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When calamity comes, the wicked are brought down,
    but even in death the righteous seek refuge in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom reposes in the heart of the discerning
    and even among fools she lets herself be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness exalts a nation,
    but sin condemns any people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king delights in a wise servant,
    but a shameful servant arouses his fury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gentle answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the wise adorns knowledge,
    but the mouth of the fool gushes folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are everywhere,
    keeping watch on the wicked and the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soothing tongue is a tree of life,
    but a perverse tongue crushes the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool spurns a parent’s discipline,
    but whoever heeds correction shows prudence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the righteous contains great treasure,
    but the income of the wicked brings ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the wise spread knowledge,
    but the hearts of fools are not upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests the sacrifice of the wicked,
    but the prayer of the upright pleases him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests the way of the wicked,
    but he loves those who pursue righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stern discipline awaits anyone who leaves the path;
    the one who hates correction will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death and Destruction lie open before the Lord –
    how much more do human hearts!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mockers resent correction,
    so they avoid the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A happy heart makes the face cheerful,
    but heartache crushes the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The discerning heart seeks knowledge,
    but the mouth of a fool feeds on folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the days of the oppressed are wretched,
    but the cheerful heart has a continual feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a little with the fear of the Lord
    than great wealth with turmoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a dish of vegetables with love
    than a fattened calf with hatred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A hot-tempered person stirs up conflict,
    but the one who is patient calms a quarrel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the sluggard is blocked with thorns,
    but the path of the upright is a highway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son brings joy to his father,
    but a foolish man despises his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly brings joy to one who has no sense,
    but whoever has understanding keeps a straight course.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plans fail for lack of counsel,
    but with many advisors they succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person finds joy in giving an apt reply –
    and how good is a timely word!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The path of life leads upward for the prudent
    to keep them from going down to the realm of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord tears down the house of the proud,
    but he sets the widow’s boundary stones in place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests the thoughts of the wicked,
    but gracious words are pure in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The greedy bring ruin to their households,
    but the one who hates bribes will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the righteous weighs its answers,
    but the mouth of the wicked gushes evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is far from the wicked,
    but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Light in a messenger’s eyes brings joy to the heart,
    and good news gives health to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever heeds life-giving correction
    will be at home among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who disregard discipline despise themselves,
    but the one who heeds correction gains understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom’s instruction is to fear the Lord,
    and humility comes before honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To humans belong the plans of the heart,
    but from the Lord comes the proper answer of the tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All a person’s ways seem pure to them,
    but motives are weighed by the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit to the Lord whatever you do,
    and he will establish your plans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord works out everything to its proper end –
    even the wicked for a day of disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests all the proud of heart.
    Be sure of this: they will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through love and faithfulness sin is atoned for;
    through the fear of the Lord evil is avoided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Lord takes pleasure in anyone’s way,
    he causes their enemies to make peace with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a little with righteousness
    than much gain with injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In their hearts humans plan their course,
    but the Lord establishes their steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of a king speak as an oracle,
    and his mouth does not betray justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honest scales and balances belong to the Lord;
    all the weights in the bag are of his making.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings detest wrongdoing,
    for a throne is established through righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings take pleasure in honest lips;
    they value the one who speaks what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king’s wrath is a messenger of death,
    but the wise will appease it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a king’s face brightens, it means life;
    his favour is like a rain cloud in spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much better to get wisdom than gold,
    to get insight rather than silver!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highway of the upright avoids evil;
    those who guard their ways preserve their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pride goes before destruction,
    a haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to be lowly in spirit along with the oppressed
    than to share plunder with the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever gives heed to instruction prospers,
    and blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise in heart are called discerning,
    and gracious words promote instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prudence is a fountain of life to the prudent,
    but folly brings punishment to fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hearts of the wise make their mouths prudent,
    and their lips promote instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gracious words are a honeycomb,
    sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that appears to be right,
    but in the end it leads to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The appetite of labourers works for them;
    their hunger drives them on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoundrel plots evil,
    and on their lips it is like a scorching fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A perverse person stirs up conflict,
    and a gossip separates close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A violent person entices their neighbour
    and leads them down a path that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever winks with their eye is plotting perversity;
    whoever purses their lips is bent on evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grey hair is a crown of splendour;
    it is attained in the way of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a patient person than a warrior,
    one with self-control than one who takes a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot is cast into the lap,
    but its every decision is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a dry crust with peace and quiet
    than a house full of feasting, with strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent servant will rule over a disgraceful son,
    and will share the inheritance as one of the family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crucible for silver and the furnace for gold,
    but the Lord tests the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked person listens to deceitful lips;
    a liar pays attention to a destructive tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever mocks the poor shows contempt for their Maker;
    whoever gloats over disaster will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Children’s children are a crown to the aged,
    and parents are the pride of their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eloquent lips are unsuited to a godless fool –
    how much worse lying lips to a ruler!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A bribe is seen as a charm by the one who gives it;
    they think success will come at every turn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever would foster love covers over an offence,
    but whoever repeats the matter separates close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rebuke impresses a discerning person
    more than a hundred lashes a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evildoers foster rebellion against God;
    the messenger of death will be sent against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to meet a bear robbed of her cubs
    than a fool bent on folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil will never leave the house
    of one who pays back evil for good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Starting a quarrel is like breaching a dam;
    so drop the matter before a dispute breaks out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Acquitting the guilty and condemning the innocent –
    the Lord detests them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should fools have money in hand to buy wisdom,
    when they are not able to understand it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A friend loves at all times,
    and a brother is born for a time of adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who has no sense shakes hands in pledge
    and puts up security for a neighbour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves a quarrel loves sin;
    whoever builds a high gate invites destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One whose heart is corrupt does not prosper;
    one whose tongue is perverse falls into trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To have a fool for a child brings grief;
    there is no joy for the parent of a godless fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A cheerful heart is good medicine,
    but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked accept bribes in secret
    to pervert the course of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A discerning person keeps wisdom in view,
    but a fool’s eyes wander to the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son brings grief to his father
    and bitterness to the mother who bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If imposing a fine on the innocent is not good,
    surely to flog honest officials is not right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who has knowledge uses words with restraint,
    and whoever has understanding is even-tempered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even fools are thought wise if they keep silent,
    and discerning if they hold their tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An unfriendly person pursues selfish ends
    and against all sound judgment starts quarrels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools find no pleasure in understanding
    but delight in airing their own opinions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When wickedness comes, so does contempt,
    and with shame comes reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the mouth are deep waters,
    but the fountain of wisdom is a rushing stream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to be partial to the wicked
    and so deprive the innocent of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of fools bring them strife,
    and their mouths invite a beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouths of fools are their undoing,
    and their lips are a snare to their very lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a gossip are like choice morsels;
    they go down to the inmost parts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who is slack in his work
    is brother to one who destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of the Lord is a fortified tower;
    the righteous run to it and are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wealth of the rich is their fortified city;
    they imagine it a wall too high to scale.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before a downfall the heart is haughty,
    but humility comes before honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To answer before listening –
    that is folly and shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The human spirit can endure in times of illness,
    but a crushed spirit who can bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the discerning acquires knowledge,
    for the ears of the wise seek it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift opens the way
    and ushers the giver into the presence of the great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a lawsuit the first to speak seems right,
    until someone comes forward and cross-examines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Casting the lot settles disputes
    and keeps strong opponents apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A brother wronged is more unyielding than a fortified city;
    disputes are like the barred gates of a citadel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of their mouth a person’s stomach is filled;
    with the harvest of their lips they are satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue has the power of life and death,
    and those who love it will eat its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who finds a wife finds what is good
    and receives favour from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor plead for mercy,
    but the rich answer harshly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who has unreliable friends soon comes to ruin,
    but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better the poor whose way of life is blameless
    than a fool whose lips are perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Desire without knowledge is not good –
    how much more will hasty feet miss the way!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person’s own folly leads to their ruin,
    yet their heart rages against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth attracts many friends,
    but even the closest friend of the poor person deserts them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
    and whoever pours out lies will not go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many curry favour with a ruler,
    and everyone is the friend of one who gives gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor are shunned by all their relatives –
    how much more do their friends avoid them!
Though the poor pursue them with pleading,
    they are nowhere to be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who gets wisdom loves life;
    the one who cherishes understanding will soon prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
    and whoever pours out lies will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury –
    how much worse for a slave to rule over princes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person’s wisdom yields patience;
    it is to one’s glory to overlook an offence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king’s rage is like the roar of a lion,
    but his favour is like dew on the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish child is a father’s ruin,
    and a quarrelsome wife is like
    the constant dripping of a leaky roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Houses and wealth are inherited from parents,
    but a prudent wife is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Laziness brings on deep sleep,
    and the shiftless go hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever keeps commandments keeps their life,
    but whoever shows contempt for their ways will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is kind to the poor lends to the Lord,
    and he will reward them for what they have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discipline your children, for in that there is hope;
    do not be a willing party to their death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A hot-tempered person must pay the penalty;
    rescue them, and you will have to do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to advice and accept discipline,
    and at the end you will be counted among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the plans in a person’s heart,
    but it is the Lord’s purpose that prevails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What a person desires is unfailing love;
    better to be poor than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord leads to life;
    then one rests content, untouched by trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sluggard buries his hand in the dish;
    he will not even bring it back to his mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flog a mocker, and the simple will learn prudence;
    rebuke the discerning, and they will gain knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever robs their father and drives out their mother
    is a child who brings shame and disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stop listening to instruction, my son,
    and you will stray from the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A corrupt witness mocks at justice,
    and the mouth of the wicked gulps down evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Penalties are prepared for mockers,
    and beatings for the backs of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wine is a mocker and beer a brawler;
    whoever is led astray by them is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king’s wrath strikes terror like the roar of a lion;
    those who anger him forfeit their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is to one’s honour to avoid strife,
    but every fool is quick to quarrel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sluggards do not plough in season;
    so at harvest time they look but find nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The purposes of a person’s heart are deep waters,
    but one who has insight draws them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many claim to have unfailing love,
    but a faithful person who can find?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous lead blameless lives;
    blessed are their children after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a king sits on his throne to judge,
    he winnows out all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can say, ‘I have kept my heart pure;
    I am clean and without sin’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Differing weights and differing measures –
    the Lord detests them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even small children are known by their actions,
    so is their conduct really pure and upright?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ears that hear and eyes that see –
    the Lord has made them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not love sleep or you will grow poor;
    stay awake and you will have food to spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘It’s no good, it’s no good!’ says the buyer –
    then goes off and boasts about the purchase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gold there is, and rubies in abundance,
    but lips that speak knowledge are a rare jewel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take the garment of one who puts up security for a stranger;
    hold it in pledge if it is done for an outsider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Food gained by fraud tastes sweet,
    but one ends up with a mouth full of gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plans are established by seeking advice;
    so if you wage war, obtain guidance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gossip betrays a confidence;
    so avoid anyone who talks too much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If someone curses their father or mother,
    their lamp will be snuffed out in pitch darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inheritance claimed too soon
    will not be blessed at the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, ‘I’ll pay you back for this wrong!’
    Wait for the Lord, and he will avenge you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord detests differing weights,
    and dishonest scales do not please him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person’s steps are directed by the Lord.
    How then can anyone understand their own way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a trap to dedicate something rashly
    and only later to consider one’s vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise king winnows out the wicked;
    he drives the threshing wheel over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The human spirit is the lamp of the Lord
    that sheds light on one’s inmost being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Love and faithfulness keep a king safe;
    through love his throne is made secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The glory of young men is their strength,
    grey hair the splendour of the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blows and wounds scrub away evil,
    and beatings purge the inmost being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the Lord’s hand the king’s heart is a stream of water
    that he channels towards all who please him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person may think their own ways are right,
    but the Lord weighs the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To do what is right and just
    is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Haughty eyes and a proud heart –
    the unploughed field of the wicked – produce sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the diligent lead to profit
    as surely as haste leads to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fortune made by a lying tongue
    is a fleeting vapour and a deadly snare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The violence of the wicked will drag them away,
    for they refuse to do what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the guilty is devious,
    but the conduct of the innocent is upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to live on a corner of the roof
    than share a house with a quarrelsome wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked crave evil;
    their neighbours get no mercy from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a mocker is punished, the simple gain wisdom;
    by paying attention to the wise they get knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Righteous One takes note of the house of the wicked
    and brings the wicked to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever shuts their ears to the cry of the poor
    will also cry out and not be answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift given in secret soothes anger,
    and a bribe concealed in the cloak pacifies great wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When justice is done, it brings joy to the righteous
    but terror to evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever strays from the path of prudence
    comes to rest in the company of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves pleasure will become poor;
    whoever loves wine and olive oil will never be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked become a ransom for the righteous,
    and the unfaithful for the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to live in a desert
    than with a quarrelsome and nagging wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise store up choice food and olive oil,
    but fools gulp theirs down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever pursues righteousness and love
    finds life, prosperity and honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who is wise can go up against the city of the mighty
    and pull down the stronghold in which they trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who guard their mouths and their tongues
    keep themselves from calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proud and arrogant person – ‘Mocker’ is his name –
    behaves with insolent fury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The craving of a sluggard will be the death of him,
    because his hands refuse to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long he craves for more,
    but the righteous give without sparing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable –
    how much more so when brought with evil intent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will perish,
    but a careful listener will testify successfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked put up a bold front,
    but the upright give thought to their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no wisdom, no insight, no plan
    that can succeed against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horse is made ready for the day of battle,
    but victory rests with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good name is more desirable than great riches;
    to be esteemed is better than silver or gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rich and poor have this in common:
    The Lord is the Maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prudent see danger and take refuge,
    but the simple keep going and pay the penalty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Humility is the fear of the Lord;
    its wages are riches and honour and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the paths of the wicked are snares and pitfalls,
    but those who would preserve their life stay far from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Start children off on the way they should go,
    and even when they are old they will not turn from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich rule over the poor,
    and the borrower is slave to the lender.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever sows injustice reaps calamity,
    and the rod they wield in fury will be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The generous will themselves be blessed,
    for they share their food with the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drive out the mocker, and out goes strife;
    quarrels and insults are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who loves a pure heart and who speaks with grace
    will have the king for a friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord keep watch over knowledge,
    but he frustrates the words of the unfaithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard says, ‘There’s a lion outside!
    I’ll be killed in the public square!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of an adulterous woman is a deep pit;
    a man who is under the Lord’s wrath falls into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly is bound up in the heart of a child,
    but the rod of discipline will drive it far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who oppresses the poor to increase his wealth
    and one who gives gifts to the rich – both come to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention and turn your ear to the sayings of the wise;
    apply your heart to what I teach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for it is pleasing when you keep them in your heart
    and have all of them ready on your lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that your trust may be in the Lord,
    I teach you today, even you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I not written thirty sayings for you,
    sayings of counsel and knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
teaching you to be honest and to speak the truth,
    so that you bring back truthful reports
    to those you serve?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not exploit the poor because they are poor
    and do not crush the needy in court,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord will take up their case
    and will exact life for life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not make friends with a hot-tempered person,
    do not associate with one easily angered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
or you may learn their ways
    and get yourself ensnared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be one who shakes hands in pledge
    or puts up security for debts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if you lack the means to pay,
    your very bed will be snatched from under you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not move an ancient boundary stone
    set up by your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you sit to dine with a ruler,
    note well what is before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and put a knife to your throat
    if you are given to gluttony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
